Name: Isis
Description: This fragment of a Greek type of figurine represents the head of the goddess Isis. She is wearing a diadem decorated with a pearl, attributed to the Greek goddess Aphrodite, and by the Hathoric crown composed of a solar disk surmounted by two plumes and surrounded by horns and ears of corn. This latter element accentuates the agrarian character of the goddess "of a thousand names". The piece was recovered at Herakleopolis Magna in a roman house dating from the second half of the 3rd century of our era.
